question.title: Tomcat gives 404 when i call my servlet

node.contents: I can't access to my servlet i call with a form. I checked the arborescence, web.xml and the form, but i can't see any problem. I use Eclipse with a "web dynamic project".

node.contents: This is the correct answer. @toshiro92 You need to find out what your context path is (possibly changing it to something simpler) and change your form action url to reflect it.

node.contents: Change your <form> html to

node.contents: When you're posting to /urlCommandeServ you're asking Tomcat (or your web server) to look for a web application named urlCommandeServ which isn't there and hence you get a 404.

astNode.text: When you're posting to /urlCommandeServ you're asking Tomcat (or your web server) to look for a web application named urlCommandeServ which isn't there and hence you get a 404.

node.contents: See: SO Link

astNode.text: See: SO Link

node.contents: "If this code works in your J2SE it means you need to have a JAR file somewhere containing com.mysql.jdbc.Driver class (so called JDBC driver). This JAR needs to be visible in Tomcat. So, I would suggest to place mysql-jdbc.jar at physical location to /WEB-INF/lib directory of your project."

astNode.text: "If this code works in your J2SE it means you need to have a JAR file somewhere containing com.mysql.jdbc.Driver class (so called JDBC driver). This JAR needs to be visible in Tomcat. So, I would suggest to place mysql-jdbc.jar at physical location to /WEB-INF/lib directory of your project."
